abstracts.cdata!:
The Finance and Enterprise Development
            Project is rated as satisfactory, sustainability as likely,
            institutional development impact as substantial, Bank
            performance as satisfactory, and borrower performance as
            satisfactory. The general economic decline in 1994-1996 a
            and social tension arising from the transition program, and
            frequent changes in the government structure and counterpart
            arrangements affected project implementation. The
            Borrower's ownership of and commitment to the project
            is critical for the success of the project. Flexibility of
            design is essential in technical assistance operations,
            particularly in rapidly changing environments of a
            transition economy. The project design and implementation
            arrangements should be simple. Close and frequent
            collaboration with project beneficiaries is an essential
            element of technical assistance projects and helps to
            reinforce borrower commitment. Complex IT procurement
            requires close supervision and strong technical support both
            o the part of the beneficiary and the Bank. Continuity in
            staffing is a critical factor for project success. Funding
            of the project audit should be incorporated into the project
            costs to ensure that adequate counterpart funding will be available.
